Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the strength of Bernie Sanders as a candidate against the Republicans compared to Hillary Clinton.
Lack enough support: There is limited support for the claim as only a few polls have been mentioned, and they do not consistently show Sanders as a stronger candidate.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the polls mentioned are representative of the entire population and accurately predict the outcome of the general election.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the polls do not consistently favor Sanders as a stronger candidate, and there are instances where Clinton performs better against certain Republican candidates.
Falters at times: The claim falters in providing a comprehensive analysis of all available polls and fails to consider other factors that may influence the strength of a candidate against Republicans.
Understate: The claim may understate the performance of Hillary Clinton against certain Republican candidates, as she is shown to perform better than Sanders in some matchups.
